meanings.definition: To polish or clean (an object) by rubbing or brushing.
meanings.sent1: She furbishes her shoes until they shine brightly.
meanings.sent2: He furbishes the silverware before setting the table.
meanings.sent3: The little girl furbishes her teddy bear, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: The artist furbishes the painting with delicate strokes, bringing out its true beauty.
meanings.sent5: The sun furbishes the sky with vibrant colors at dawn.

meanings.definition: To give a fresh look or appearance to (something).
meanings.sent1: The interior designer furbishes the room with modern furniture.
meanings.sent2: She furbishes her wardrobe with trendy clothes for the new season.
meanings.sent3: The magician furbishes his hat, making it look like new for his next trick.
meanings.sent4: The rain furbishes the garden, making the flowers look refreshed and vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The chef furbishes the dish with colorful garnishes before serving.

meanings.definition: To improve or enhance (something) by adding details or finishing touches.
meanings.sent1: The tailor furbishes the dress with intricate lace patterns.
meanings.sent2: He furbishes his speech with inspiring quotes to motivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The robot furbishes itself with new upgrades, becoming more efficient.
meanings.sent4: The architect furbishes the building with unique decorations, making it stand out.
meanings.sent5: The teacher furbishes the lesson with engaging activities to keep the students interested.
